channel.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
channel.description:
> ## [Whonix](https://www.whonix.org): A High Security Method of Surfing the Internet > > Whonix is a desktop operating system designed for advanced security and privacy. Whonix mitigates the threat of common attack vectors while maintaining usability. Online anonymity is realized via fail-safe, automatic, and desktop-wide use of the Tor network. A heavily reconfigured Debian base is run inside multiple virtual machines, providing a substantial layer of protection from malware and IP address leaks. Commonly used applications are pre-installed and safely pre-configured for immediate use. The user is not jeopardized by installing additional applications or personalizing the desktop. Whonix is under active development and is the only operating system designed to be run inside a VM and paired with Tor.
After approximately one year of development, the Whonix Project is proud to announce the release of Whonix 15.
Whonix 15 is based on the Debian `buster` (Debian `10`) distribution. This means users have access to many new software packages in concert with existing packages, such as a modern branch of GNuPG, and more.
**Major Changes and New Features**
* https://forums.whonix.org/t/port-whonix-from-debian-stretch-to-debian-buster/7101 * [kernel hardening](https://forums.whonix.org/t/kernel-hardening/7296) * https://forums.whonix.org/t/blacklist-uncommon-network-protocols/7391 * [systemd unit sandboxing](https://forums.whonix.org/t/apply-systemd-sandboxing-by-default-to-some-services/7590) * improve entropy collection through extensive research and installation by default of https://forums.whonix.org/t/jitterentropy-rngd/7204 * research implications of [spectre / meltdown / retpoline / L1 Terminal Fault (L1TF)](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-vulerable-due-to-missing-processor-microcode-packages-spectre-meltdown-retpoline-l1-terminal-fault-l1tf/5739) vs Whonix * Non-Qubes-Whonix: https://forums.whonix.org/t/kloak-keystroke-anonymization-tool/7089 * Non-Qubes-Whonix: [Whonix Live](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live) / Live Mode Indicator / [grub-live / grub-default-live](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Grub-live) * Non-Qubes-Whonix: switch desktop environment from KDE to XFCE ([poll](https://forums.whonix.org/t/user-poll-xfce-vs-kde-kde-deprecation-considered/6235)) ([other desktop environments](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Other_Desktop_Environments)) * Non-Qubes-Whonix: [reduced image size using zerofree](https://forums.whonix.org/t/reducing-size-of-ova-images/5095) * Whonix VirtualBox: [CLI version](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/CLI) (Whonix ™ with CLI is a version suited for advanced users -- those who want Whonix ™ without a GUI.) * Whonix VirtualBox: [unified ova downloads](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-virtualbox-14-0-1-4-4-unified-ova-downloads-point-release/6996) * Qubes-Whonix: [change Qubes-Whonix default applications from KDE-ish to XFCE-ish](https://phabricator.whonix.org/T888) * Qubes-Whonix: simplify installation of [VM kernel](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/managing-vm-kernel/#using-kernel-installed-in-the-vm) by installing the same recommended Qubes packages as Qubes Debian packages ([source 1](https://github.com/Whonix/qubes-whonix/commit/8d8ab41bbf9c7fa63f3e79b8511d439efe33caeb) ([source 2](https://github.com/Whonix/qubes-whonix/commit/c08dfed97cfba369ff753b4d96755b47240fffb2)) * Whonix KVM: [serial console support](https://forums.whonix.org/t/how-do-i-enter-the-whonix-shell-from-cli/7271) * update [sdwdate time sources](https://forums.whonix.org/t/suggest-trustworthy-tor-hidden-services-as-time-sources-for-sdwdate/856) * [List of processed Whonix 15 tickets](https://phabricator.whonix.org/maniphest/query/G_KnS3xVRwrU/#R) * [arm64 / RPi](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-for-arm64-raspberry-pi-rpi/1788) port * install by default zulucrypt, qtox, onionshare, keepassxc, firejail * new usability wrappers: [scurlget](https://github.com/Whonix/scurl/blob/master/man/scurl-download.1.ronn), [curlget](https://github.com/Whonix/scurl/blob/master/man/curl-download.1.ronn), [pwchange](https://github.com/Whonix/usability-misc/blob/master/man/pwchange.8.ronn), [upgrade-nonroot](https://github.com/Whonix/usability-misc/blob/master/man/upgrade-nonroot.8.ronn), [apt-get-noninteractive](https://github.com/Whonix/usability-misc/blob/master/man/apt-get-noninteractive.8.ronn), [apt-get-update-plus](https://github.com/Whonix/usability-misc/blob/master/man/apt-get-update-plus.8.ronn) * remove mixmaster, ricochet since dead upstream * support for [Bisq - The P2P Exchange Network](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Bisq) * port build script to cowbuilder; build packages in chroot and use [mmdebstrap](https://forums.whonix.org/t/fixed-apt-rce-announced-new-whonix-images-needed-whonix-build-not-safe-at-the-moment/6715) for better security * add UsrMerge compatibility
**ChangeLog**
* [Full ChangeLog](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Release_Notes#Whonix_.E2.84.A2_15_Changelog) * [list of all source code between Whonix 14 and Whonix 15](https://github.com/Whonix/Whonix/compare/14.0.0.6.9-developers-only...15.0.0.3.3-developers-only)
**Issues**
Please report any other issues to us in the forums, after first searching for whether it is already known.
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Known_Issues
**Download Whonix 15**
Whonix is cross-platform and can be installed on the Windows, macOS, Linux or Qubes operating systems. Choose your operating system from the link below and follow the instructions to install it.
https://www.whonix.org/download/
**Upgrade to Whonix 15**
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Upgrading_Whonix_14_to_Whonix_15
**Whonix 14 Deprecation Notice**
As per [Whonix Support Schedule](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Support_Schedule), support for Whonix 14 will end in 1 month.
**What’s Next?**
Work on Whonix 15 is [ongoing](https://phabricator.whonix.org/maniphest/query/BYmg1nGikkjV/#R) and interested users can refer to the [Whonix 16 roadmap](https://phabricator.whonix.org/maniphest/query/6pke.GIJfSNH/#R) to see where Whonix is heading. Major items include a https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-host-operating-system/3931 ([tickets](https://phabricator.whonix.org/project/view/26/)); [live mode](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-desktop-installer-with-calamares-field-report/7350) ([tickets](https://phabricator.whonix.org/project/view/145/)); https://forums.whonix.org/t/policy-for-inclusion-of-compiled-software/6635 (for [install electrum bitcoin thin client by default?](https://phabricator.whonix.org/T215))
We need your help and there are various ways to contribute to Whonix - donating or investing your time will help the project immensely. Come and talk with us!

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: tempest
item.description:
MouseFan:

Just wondering. What applications are preinstalled by Whonix developers? I can not find the mat,

“mat” is no longer in active development by the original developer. however, debian buster, which whonix 15 is based on, has “mat2.”

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Meaning, Whonix no longer ships desktop shortcuts on its own. However,
Whonix does not restrict what the software Whonix is based on (default
desktop is XFCE) lets you do. So if you figure out how to use shortcuts
on XFCE, you’re free to use it.

Read full topic

In the repository Debian Buster no old package mat-gui. Any open-source alternative?

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released

item.description:

Thanks for all the work in reaching Whonix 15.

item.dc:creator: HehBoy
item.description:
Patrick:

Please describe. “freezing” is understood as “nothing reacts anymore”. And such issues are often resolved by adding more RAM. You might mean something different by “freezing”.

When I open the XFCE menu in the left corner - menu items responses very slow - about 10+ second when I navigate mouse on them. I gave about 6000 RAM. But another parts of system and apps work normaly

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
likewhonix via Whonix Forum:

  • copied text files and some files from shared folder, after reboot, they are blank file(0 byte)
    is this bug?

Instruction for reproduction required as per:

Whonix

Reporting Bugs

How to Report (Security) Bugs in the Whonix ™ Operating System. Software development cycle, patches, and responsiveness to feedback.

or virus?

See:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_in_Real_World#Indicators_of_Compromise

  • on the gateway, connected tor network already, but when I open onion circute from tor-control-panel, it says not connected tor network and it is blank screen

Do log analysis.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Log_Analysis

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released

HehBoy:

freezing

Please describe. “freezing” is understood as “nothing reacts anymore”. And such issues are often resolved by adding more RAM. You might mean something different by “freezing”.

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
MouseFan:

What applications are preinstalled by Whonix developers?

This is defined in this file:

https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/blob/master/debian/control

MouseFan:

I see applications duplicate each other terminal and xterm.

Likely due to technical limitations (dependencies). (Some Qubes package depends on xterm, not Whonix, I think.)

MouseFan:

they will decide themselves that they want these applications or some other. It is not intrusive and I think more secure.

The following applies:

Whonix

Dev/Default Application Policy

Design Documentation - How to decide which apps come with Whonix ™?

Also:

law of triviality / bikeshed Development
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_of_triviality http://bikeshed.com

There’s indeed necessarily a degree of arbitrariness. There’s many flavors between minimalism and overload. Due to this and above it’s mostly the top contributors of Whonix who get to “vote”.

Advanced users can install CLI version of Whonix and then either package hardened-desktop-environment-essential-gui among others from https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/blob/master/debian/control or go for https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Other_Desktop_Environments.

MouseFan:

Especially while the system theme is a mix of white and black. I understand that system theme is cosmetics, but put yourself in the place of a new user, who is technically not advanced. Whonix deserves to have a beautiful system theme! I do not want to offend the preferences of the developers just said what I think.

Mostly default theme. No theme customization yet due to lack of resources (developers making the changes). See also XFCE theming - a few suggestions - it “only” needs source code contributions.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: MouseFan
item.description:
Just wondering. What applications are preinstalled by Whonix developers? I can not find the mat, but I see applications duplicate each other terminal and xterm. For each operating system there is a basic set of applications - a text editor, image viewer, video viewer, file manager, terminal, browser, and some others. If users need specific applications such as xpra, xpra browser, OnionShare, qTox, ZuluCrypt, gpa, KeePassXC, they will decide themselves that they want these applications or some other. It is not intrusive and I think more secure. Especially while the system theme is a mix of white and black. I understand that system theme is cosmetics, but put yourself in the place of a new user, who is technically not advanced. Whonix deserves to have a beautiful system theme! I do not want to offend the preferences of the developers just said what I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix 15 XFCE has much lower resource requirements than Whonix 14 KDE.

Try increase VM RAM.

Also:

Whonix

Reporting Bugs

How to Report (Security) Bugs in the Whonix ™ Operating System. Software development cycle, patches, and responsiveness to feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 15 has been Released
item.dc:creator: MouseFan
item.description:
It is not possible to delete files in share folders (sf_Share). There is no Delete in the Right Mouse Button menu.

Cant unpack .tar.gz have error.
Cant add file to archive through Right Click Mouse Button
Cant create archive through xarchiver. I add files but have error:
Cant open file and Archive format is not recognized!
And impossible add more than one file.

Whisker, notification and PulseAudio Plugin icon (volume control) have white color. Solution - create file ~/.config/gtk-3.0/gtk.css and add:

.xfce4-panel.background {
  background-color: rgba(35, 35, 35, 0.8);
  color: #fcfcfc;
  font-weight: normal; }
  .xfce4-panel.background button {
	background-image: none;
	background-color: transparent;
	border-radius: 0;
	border-color: transparent;
	box-shadow: none;
	padding: 0 1px;
	color: #fcfcfc;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); }
	.xfce4-panel.background button:active, .xfce4-panel.background button:checked {
	  background-image: none;
	  background-color: transparent;
	  border-color: transparent;
	  color: #fcfcfc;
	  transition: none; }
	.xfce4-panel.background button:hover, .xfce4-panel.background button:active:hover, .xfce4-panel.background button:checked:hover {
	  border-color: transparent;
	  background-image: none;
	  background-color: rgba(0, 50, 90, 1.0);
	  color: #fcfcfc;
	  box-shadow: none;
	  transition: none; }
  .xfce4-panel.background entry {
	caret-color: #212121; }
  .xfce4-panel.background menu {
	-gtk-icon-effect: none;
	text-shadow: none; }

launch in terminal
xfce4-panel -r

In Whonix 14, the Dusk theme worked correctly. In Whonix 15 apps menu and background white. It does not look good. I create topic on Xfce forum with the problem but I cant post link

I think Whonix needs to be made not only safe but also beautiful. I suggest in Dusk theme to replace the huge and glossy window headers with something more minimalist, for example Axiomd (theme souce code open). As i said i can’t post links and images.

Read full topic
